doc.after: The British Antarctic Survey (BAS) operates a single Dash 7 in support of its research program in Antarctica. The aircraft undertakes regular shuttle flights between either Stanley on the Falkland Islands, or Punta Arenas in Chile, and the Rothera Research Station on Adelaide Island. It also operates to and from the ice runway at the Sky Blu Logistics Facility on the Antarctic mainland.[16] A single DHC-7 150IR is owned and operated by Transport Canada conducting coastal pollution and ice patrols across the Canadian Arctic.
